element.desc: contains a single TEI-conformant document, comprising a TEI header and a text, either in isolation or as part of a teiCorpus element.
contiene un único documento TEI, compuesto de una cabecera TEI (TEI header) y un cuerpo de texto (text), aislado o como parte de un elemento corpusTei (teiCorpus).
contains any arbitrary component-level unit of text, acting as an anonymous container for phrase or inter level elements analogous to, but without the semantic baggage of, a paragraph.
contiene cualquier unidad de texto arbitraria a nivel de componente, actuando como recipiente anónimo para elementos frase o internivel, análogos a, pero sin el bagaje semántico de, un párrafo.
contains an abbreviation of any sort.
contiene una abreviatura de cualquier clase.

contains details of any significant additional material which may be closely associated with the manuscript being described, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments bound in with the manuscript at some earlier historical period.

contiene detalles sobre cualquier material adicional significativo que pueda estar estrechamente asociado al manuscrito que esta siendo descripto, tal como documentos no contemporáneos o fragmentos ligados al manuscrito en algún periodo histórico anterior.
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the process by which a manuscript or manuscript part entered the holding institution.
contiene cualquier información descriptiva o de otro tipo acerca del proceso por el cual un manuscrito o parte de un manuscrito ingresó en la institución que lo conserva.
contains a brief informal description of what a participant in a language interaction is doing other than speaking, if anything.
contiene una descripción informal y breve de lo que un participante en una interacción verbal está haciendo además de hablar.
name of an actor appearing within a cast list.
nombre de un actor que aparece dentro de una lista de personajes.
contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
contiene cartas, palabras, o frases insertadas en el texto por un autor, escriba, anotador, o corrector.
contains an additional name component, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name.
contiene un componente adicional del nombre, tal como un apodo, epíteto, o seudónimo, o cualquier otra frase descriptiva usada dentro de un nombre personal.
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text added by an author, scribe, annotator or corrector (see also the element add).
marca el principio de una secuencia más larga de texto agregada por un autor, escriba, anotador o corrector (ver también el elemento adicion - add).
groups additional information relating to the modern bibliography for a manuscript, its current curatorial status, and other associated materials.
agrupa información adicional relacionada con la bibliografía moderna de un manuscrito, su estado de conservación actual, y otros materiales asociados.
contains a description of any significant additions found within a manuscript, such as marginalia or other annotations.
contiene una descripción de cualquier agregado significativo encontrado en un manuscrito, como ser notas al margen o de otra índole.
contains one line of a postal or other address.
contiene una línea de una dirección postal o de otro tipo.
contains a postal or other address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.
contiene una dirección postal o de otro tipo, por ejemplo de una editorial, una organización, o un individuo.
contains information about the present custody and availability of the manuscript, and also about the record description itself.
contiene información sobre la presente custodia y disponibilidad del manuscrito, y también sobre la propia descripción del registro.
contains an informal description of a person's present or past affiliation with some organization, for example an employer or sponsor.
contiene una descripción informal de la afiliación presente o pasada de una persona con alguna organización, por ejemplo un empleador o patrocinador.
identifies an alternation or a set of choices among elements or passages.
identifica una alternancia o un conjunto de opciones entre elementos o pasajes.
groups a collection of alt elements and possibly pointers.
agrupa una colección de elementos alt y posiblemente punteros.
supplies the recommended XML name for an element, class, attribute, etc. in some language.
proporciona el nombre XML recomendado para un elemento, clase, atributo, etc. en algún idioma.
contains any form of alternative identifier used for a manuscript, such as a former catalogue number, ocellus nominum, or nickname.
contiene cualquier forma de identificador alternativo usada en un manuscrito, tal como un número de catálogo anterior, ocellus nominum, o apodo.
contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. an article or poem) published within a monograph or journal and not as an independent publication.
contiene elementos bibliográficos que describen un ítem (por ejemplo un artículo o poema) publicado dentro de una monografía o publicación periódica y no como publicación independiente.
attaches an identifier to a point within a text, whether or not it corresponds with a textual element.
coloca un identificador en un punto dentro de un texto, corresponda o no con un elemento textual.
contains one entry in a critical apparatus, with an optional lemma and at least one reading.
contiene una entrada en un aparato crítico, con un lema opcional y por lo menos una lectura.
encodes an arc, the connection from one node to another in a graph.
codifica un arco, la conexión de un nodo a otro en un grafo.
a formal list or prose description of the topics addressed by a subdivision of a text.
una lista formal o la descripción en prosa de los temas tratados en una subdivisión de un texto.
contains the name of an attribute appearing within running text.
contiene el nombre de un atributo que aparece dentro de texto corriente.
contains the definition of a single attribute.
contiene la definición de un único atributo.
contains documentation for all the attributes associated with this element, as a series of attDef elements.
contiene la documentación de todos los atributos asociados con este elemento, como una serie de elementos defAtr (attDef).
in a bibliographic reference, contains the name of the author(s), personal or corporate, of a work; the primary statement of responsibility for any bibliographic item.
en una referencia bibliográfica, contiene el nombre del autor(es), personal o corporativo, de un trabajo; la declaración de responsabilidad primaria para cualquier objeto bibliográfico.
supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for making an electronic file available, other than a publisher or distributor.
da el nombre de una persona u agencia, que no sea un editor o distribuidor, responsable de facilitar un archivo electrónico.
supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, etc.
da información sobre la disponibilidad de un texto, por ejemplo cualquier restricción en su uso o distribución, el estado de sus derechos de autor, etc.
contains any appendixes, etc. following the main part of a text.
contiene cualquier apéndice, etc., después de la parte principal de un texto.
contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged.
contiene una cita bibliográfica parcialmente estructurada de la que los sub-componentes pueden o no etiquetarse explícitamente.
contains a fully-structured bibliographic citation, in which all components of the TEI file description are present.
contiene una cita bibliográfica totalmente estructurada en la que todos los componentes de la descripción de archivo TEI están presentes.
defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of pagenumbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work.
define el alcance de una referencia bibliográfica, por ejemplo como una lista de números de página, o como una subdivisión con nombre de un trabajo más grande.
contains a structured bibliographic citation, in which only bibliographic subelements appear and in a specified order.
contiene una cita bibliográfica estructurada en la que sólo aparecen subelementos bibliográficos y en un orden especificado.

defines a biconditional feature-structure constraint; both consequent and antecedent are specified as feature structures or groups of feature structures; the constraint is satisfied if both subsume a given feature structure, or if both do not.

define una restricción de rasgo-estructura bi-condicional; tanto el consecuente como el antecedente se especifican como estructuras de rasgo o grupos de estructuras de rasgo; la restricción se satisface si ambos subsumen una estructura de rasgos dada, o si ambos no lo hacen.
represents the value for a feature-value specification which can take either of a pair of values.
representa el valor de una especificación de rasgo-valor que puede tomar cualquiera de un par de valores.
contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript
contiene una descripción de una encuadernación, es decir el tipo de cubierta, etc., aplicados a un manuscrito
describes the present and former bindings of a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct binding elements, one for each binding of the manuscript.

describe las encuadernaciones actual y previas de un manuscrito, ya sea como una serie de párrafos o como una serie de elementos encuadernación (binding) distintos, uno por cada encuadernación del manuscrito.
contains information about a person's birth, such as its date and place.
contiene información sobre el nacimiento de una persona, como ser su fecha y lugar.
a geo-political unit containing one or more nation states.
una unidad geo-política que contiene uno o más países.
contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.
contiene el cuerpo completo de un único texto unitario, excluyendo cualquier tipo de prólogo (front) o epílogo (back).
describes a broadcast used as the source of a spoken text.
describe una emisión de un programa usada como fuente de un texto oral.
contains the primary statement of responsibility given for a work on its title page or at the head or end of the work.
contiene la declaración primaria de responsabilidad dada para un trabajo en su página de título o en la cabecera o final del trabajo.
represents a character.
representa un carácter.
marks the point at which a metrical line may be divided.
marca el punto en el cual una línea métrica puede ser dividida.
describes a particular camera angle or viewpoint in a screen play.
describe un ángulo de cámara o punto de vista particular en una obra para la pantalla.
contains the text of a caption or other text displayed as part of a film script or screen play.
contiene el texto de un subtítulo/leyenda u otro texto desplegado como parte de un guión cinematográfico u obra para la pantalla.
contains grammatical case information given by a dictionary for a given form.
contiene información del caso gramatical dada por un diccionario para una forma dada.
groups one or more individual castItem elements within a cast list.
agrupa uno o más elementos pers (castItem) individuales dentro de una lista de personajes.
contains a single entry within a cast list, describing either a single role or a list of non-speaking roles.
contiene una única entrada dentro de una lista de personajes, describiendo un único rol o una lista de roles mudos.
contains a single cast list or dramatis personae.
contiene una única lista del personajes o dramatis personae.
describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc.

describe una categoría dentro de una taxonomía o tipología de texto, ya sea en forma de una descripción breve en prosa o mediante los parámetros circunstanciales usados por el elemento formal descTexto (textDesc) de TEI.
specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology.
especifica una o más categorías definidas dentro de una taxonomía o tipología de texto.
contains discussion of the catchwords found within a manuscript.
contiene la discusión de los reclamos encontrados dentro de un manuscrito.
contains an individual descriptive category, possibly nested within a superordinate category, within a user-defined taxonomy.
contiene una categoría descriptiva individual, posiblemente anidada dentro de una categoría superordinada, dentro de una taxonomía definida por el usuario.
marks the boundary between one column of a text and the next in a standard reference system.
marca el límite entre una columna de texto y la siguiente en un sistema de referencia estándar.
contains one cell of a table.
contiene una célda de una tabla.
indicates the degree of certainty or uncertainty associated with some aspect of the text markup.
indica el grado de certeza o incertidumbre asociado con algún aspecto del marcado del texto.
summarizes a particular change or correction made to a particular version of an electronic text which is shared between several researchers.
resume un cambio particular o corrección hecha a una versión particular de un texto electrónico que es compartido entre varios investigadores.

describes the medium or the channel by which a text is delivered or experienced. For a written text, this might be print, manuscript, e-mail, etc.; for a spoken one, radio, telephone, face-to-face, etc.

describe el medio o el canal por el cual un texto es entregado, transmitido o percibido. Para un texto escrito, éste puede ser impresión, manuscrito, e-mail, etc.; para un texto oral: radio, teléfono, cara-a-cara, etc.
provides descriptive information about a character.
proporciona información descriptiva sobre un carácter.
provides descriptive information about characters or glyphs.
proporciona información descriptiva sobre carácteres o glifos.
contains the name of a character, expressed following Unicode conventions.
contiene el nombre de un carácter, expresado siguiendo las convenciones de Unicode.
provides a name and value for some property of the parent character or glyph.
proporciona un nombre y valor para alguna propiedad del carácter o glifo padre.
a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source.
una cita de algún otro documento, junto con una referencia bibliográfica a su fuente.
represents a grammatical clause.
representa una cláusula gramatical.
contains the classification code used for this text in some standard classification system.
contiene el código de clasificación usado para este texto en algún sistema de clasificación estándar.
contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.
contiene una o más taxonomías que definen cualquier código clasificatorio usado en otra parte del texto.
contains reference information for a TEI element class; that is a group of elements which appear together in content models, or which share some common attribute, or both.

contiene información de referencia sobre una clase de elementos TEI; éstas son grupos de elementos que aparecen juntos en los modelos de contenidos, o qué comparten algún atributo común, o ambas cosas a la vez.
specifies all the classes of which the documented element or class is a member or subclass.
especifica todas las clases de las cuales el elemento o clase documentado es un miembro o subclase.
groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a final group at the end of a division, especially of a letter.
agrupa la fecha (dateline), pie de autor (byline), saludo (salutation), y frases similares que aparecen como grupo final al final de una división, sobre todo en una carta.
contains literal code.
contiene código literal.
contains one column of a multi-column reference edition.
contiene una columna de una edición de referencia multi-columna.
contains (or points to) several feature structures which together provide a value for their parent feature element, organized as indicated by the value of the org attribute.
contiene (o apunta a) algunas estructuras de rasgo que juntas dan un valor a su elemento de rasgo padre, organizadas según indica el valor del atributo org.
contains a description of how the leaves or bifolia are physically arranged.
contiene una descripción de cómo se colocan las hojas o bifolios físicamente.
contains the name of a collection of manuscripts, not necessarily located within a single repository.
contiene el nombre de una colección de manuscritos, no necesariamente ubicada dentro de un solo repositorio.
contains a collocate of the headword.
contiene una colocación del vocablo.

contains the text of any colophon attached to a particular manuscript item: that is, an inscription, usually found at a break point such as the end of a text or codex, usually containing information about the production of the manuscript, such as the name of the scribe, the date and place of the copying, the person who commissioned the copying, etc.

contiene el texto de cualquier colofón vinculado a un elemento particular del manuscrito: es decir, una inscripción, normalmente encontrada en un punto de corte como por ejemplo el final de un texto o códice; normalmente contiene información sobre la producción del manuscrito, tal como el nombre del escriba, la fecha y lugar de la copia, la persona que comisionó la copia, etc.

defines a conditional feature-structure constraint; the consequent and the antecedent are specified as feature structures or feature-structure groups; the constraint is satisfied if both the antecedent and the consequent subsume a given feature structure, or if the antecedent does not.

define una restricción de estructura de rasgos condicional; el consecuente y el antecedente se especifican como estructuras de rasgo o grupos de estructuras de rasgo; la restricción se satisface si el antecedente y el consecuente subsumen una estructura de rasgos dada, o si el antecedente no lo hace.
contains a description of the physical condition of the manuscript.
contiene una descripción de la condición física del manuscrito.
describes the internal composition of a text or text sample, for example as fragmentary, complete, etc.
describe la composición interior de un texto o de una muestra del texto, por ejemplo como fragmentario, completo, etc.
contains the text of a declaration for the schema documented.
contiene el texto de una declaración para el esquema documentado.
contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.
contiene la forma correcta de un pasaje aparentemente erróneo en el texto de la copia.
states how and under what circumstances corrections have been made in the text.
establece cómo y bajo qué circunstancias se han hecho las correcciones en el texto.

in an address, gives the name of the nation, country, colony, or commonwealth; in a place name given as a hierarchy of geo-political units, the country is larger or administratively superior to the region and smaller than the bloc.
contains information about the creation of a text.
contiene información sobre la creación de un texto.
describes a single event during the custodial history of a manuscript.
describe un solo evento durante la historia de la custodia de un manuscrito.
contains a description of a manuscript's custodial history, either as running prose or as a series of dated custodial events.
contiene una descripción de la historia de la custodia de un manuscrito, ya sea como prosa corriente o como una serie de eventos custodiales fechados.
contains an area of damage to the text witness.
contiene un área de daño al testigo de texto.
specifies the declared value for an attribute, by referring to any datatype defined by the chosen schema language.
especifica el valor declarado para un atributo, refiriéndose a cualquier tipo de datos definido por el tipo de esquema escogido.
contains a date in any format.
contiene una fecha en cualquier formato.
contains two dates or another phrase delimiting a time period.
contiene dos fechas u otra frase delimitando un periodo de tiempo.
contains an internally structured representation of a date.
contiene una representación internamente estructurada de una fecha.
contains a brief description of the place, date, time, etc. of production of a letter, newspaper story, or other work, prefixed or suffixed to it as a kind of heading or trailer.
contiene una descripción breve del lugar, fecha, tiempo, etc. de producción de una carta, noticia periodística, u otro trabajo, prefijado o sufijado a él a modo de encabezado o pie.
the day component of a structured date.
el componente día de una fecha estructurada.
contains a description of the decoration of a manuscript, either as a sequence of paragraphs, or as a sequence of topically organised decoNote elements.
contiene una descripción de la decoración de un manuscrito, ya sea como una sucesión de párrafos, o como una sucesión de elementos notaDeco (decoNote) organizados por tema.
contains a note describing either a decorative component of a manuscript, or a fairly homogeneous class of such components.
contiene una nota que o describe un componente decorativo de un manuscrito, o una clase bastante homogénea de tales componentes.
contains definition text in a dictionary entry.
contiene el texto de la definición en una entrada de diccionario.
provides default value for a feature.
provee el valor predefinido o por defecto de un rasgo.
specifies the default declared value for an attribute.
especifica el valor por defecto declarado para un atributo.
contains a letter, word or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
contiene una carta, palabra o pasaje anulado, marcado como suprimido, o señalado como superfluo o espurio, por un autor, escriba, anotador, o corrector, en el texto de la copia.
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise signaled as superfluous or spurious by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.
marca el principio de una sucesión más larga de texto suprimido, marcado como anulado, o señalado como superfluo o espurio por un autor, escriba, anotador, o corrector.
contains a measurement measured across the spine.
contiene una medida tomada a lo ancho del lomo.
describes the nature and extent of originality of this text.
describe la naturaleza y grado de originalidad de este texto.
contains a brief description of the purpose and application for an element, attribute, or attribute value.
contiene una breve descripción del propósito y aplicación de un elemento, atributo, o valor del atributo.
encloses a part of a dictionary entry in which other phrase-level dictionary elements are freely combined.
abarca una parte de una entrada de diccionario en la cual se combinan libremente otros elementos de diccionario de nivel de frase.
(in a dictionary) contains an example text containing at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described; examples may be quoted from (named) authors or contrived.

(en un diccionario) contiene un texto de ejemplo con al menos una ocurrencia de la forma de la palabra, usada con el significado descrito; los ejemplos pueden ser cita de autores reconocidos o creados.
contains any kind of dimensional specification.
contiene cualquier forma de especificación dimensional.
that part of a relative temporal or spatial expression which indicates the distance between the place or time denoted by it and the place or time referred to within it.
esa parte de una expresión temporal o espacial relativa que indica la distancia entre el lugar o tiempo denotado por ella y el lugar o tiempo referidos dentro de ella.
identifies any word or phrase which is regarded as linguistically distinct, for example as archaic, technical, dialectal, non-preferred, etc., or as forming part of a sublanguage.
identifica cualquier palabra o frase que se considere lingüísticamente diferente, como ser arcaísmos, tecnicismos, expresiones dialectales, no preferidas, etc., o como parte de un sublenguaje.
supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for the distribution of a text.
da el nombre de una persona o agencia responsable de la distribución de un texto.
contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
contiene una subdivisión de los preliminares (front), cuerpo (body), o anexos (back) de un texto.
contains the largest possible subdivision of the body of a text.
contiene la mayor subdivisión posible del cuerpo de un texto.
contains a first-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text (the largest, if div0 is not used, the second largest if it is).
contiene una subdivisión de primer nivel de los preliminares, cuerpo, o anexos de un texto (la más grande si no se usa div0, la segunda más grande si sí se usa).
contains a second-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
contiene una subdivisión de segundo nivel de los preliminares, cuerpo, o anexos de un texto.
contains a third-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
contiene una subdivisión de tercer nivel de los preliminares, cuerpo, o anexos de un texto.
contains a fourth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
contiene una subdivisión de cuarto nivel de los preliminares, cuerpo, o anexos de un texto.
contains a fifth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
contiene una subdivisión de quinto nivel de los preliminares, cuerpo, o anexos de un texto.
contains a sixth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.
contiene una subdivisión de sexto nivel de los preliminares, cuerpo, o anexos de un texto.
contains the smallest possible subdivision of the front, body or back of a text, larger than a paragraph.
contiene la subdivisión más pequeña posible de los preliminares, cuerpo, o anexos de un texto, pero mayor que un párrafo.
indicates the location at which a textual division generated automatically by a text-processing application is to appear.
indica el lugar donde debe aparecer una división de texto generada automáticamente por una aplicación de procesamiento de texto.
contains the name of the author of the document, as given on the title page (often but not always contained in a byline).
contains the date of a document, as given (usually) on a title page.
contiene la fecha de un documento, como viene dada (normalmente) en una página del título.
contains an edition statement as presented on a title page of a document.
contains the imprint statement (place and date of publication, publisher name), as given (usually) at the foot of a title page.
contains the title of a document, including all its constituents, as given on a title page.
contiene el título de un documento, incluyendo todos sus componentes, como viene dado en una página de título.
describes the most important social context in which the text was realized or for which it is intended, for example private vs. public, education, religion, etc.
describe el contexto social principal en el cual el texto fue dado a conocer o para cual fue pensado, por ejemplo ámbito privado o público, educación, religión, etc.
provides explicitly for a leaf of an embedding tree, which may also be encoded with the eTree element.
provides an alternative to tree element for representing ordered rooted tree structures.
describes the particularities of one edition of a text.
describe las particularidades de una edición de un texto.
groups information relating to one edition of a text.
agrupa información relacionada con una edición de un texto.
secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc.
provides details of editorial principles and practices applied during the encoding of a text.
contains a brief prose description of the educational background of a participant.
contains a single example demonstrating the use of an element or attribute.
contains a single example demonstrating the use of an XML element or attribute.
documents the structure, content, and purpose of a single element type.
marks words or phrases which are stressed or emphasized for linguistic or rhetorical effect.
documents the relationship between an electronic text and the source or sources from which it was derived.
contains a reasonably well-structured dictionary entry.
contiene una entrada de diccionario razonablemente bien estructurada.
contains a dictionary entry which does not necessarily conform to the constraints imposed by the entry element.
contiene una entrada de diccionario que no cumple necesariamente las restricciones impuestas por el elemento entrada (entry).
contains a quotation, anonymous or attributed, appearing at the start of a section or chapter, or on a title page.
contains the epilogue to a drama, typically spoken by an actor out of character, possibly in association with a particular performance or venue.
provides technical details of the equipment and media used for an audio or video recording used as the source for a spoken text.
specifies a component which is considered equivalent to the parent element, either by co-reference, or by external link.
encloses the etymological information in a dictionary entry.
any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.
contains a single example demonstrating the use of an element, together with optional paragraphs of commentary.
contains the expansion of an abbreviation.

contains the text of any explicit attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, the closing words of a text or a section of a text, sometimes used as a kind of title, possibly followed by one or more rubrics or colophons.
describes the approximate size of the electronic text as stored on some carrier medium, specified in any convenient units.
represents a feature value specification, that is, the association of a name with a value of any of several different types.
declares a single feature, specifying its name, organization, range of allowed values, and optionally its default value.
describes in prose what is represented by the feature being declared and its values.
assembles library of feature elements.
describes the extent to which the text may be regarded as imaginative or non-imaginative, that is, as describing a fictional or a non-fictional world.
describe hasta que punto el texto puede considerarse como imaginativo o no imaginativo, es decir, que describe un mundo de ficción o no.
contains a brief prose description of the appearance or content of a graphic figure, for use when documenting an image without displaying it.
indicates the location of a graphic, illustration, or figure.
contains a full bibliographic description of an electronic file.
contains information concerning the manuscript's filiation, i.e. its relationship to other surviving manuscripts of the same text, its protographs, antigraphs and apographs.
specifies the first language of a participant.
especifica el primer idioma de un participante.
describes the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages in a codex.
describe el sistema o los sistemas de numeración usados para contar las hojas o páginas en un códice.
contains a forename, given or baptismal name.
contiene un nombre de pila, o bautismal.
identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the surrounding text.
identifica una palabra o frase como perteneciente a algún idioma que no sea el del texto circundante.
provides for groups of rooted trees.
provee grupos de árboles con raíz.
provides for groups of forests.
provee grupos de bosques.
groups all the information on the written and spoken forms of one headword.
agrupa toda la información sobre las formas escritas y orales de un vocablo.
contains a description of the physical format of the manuscript.
contiene una descripción del formato físico del manuscrito.
contains a mathematical or other formula.
contiene una fórmula matemática o de otro tipo.
contains any prefatory matter (headers, title page, prefaces, dedications, etc.) found at the start of a document, before the main body.
contiene cualquier materia introductoria (los títulos, la página del título, los prólogos, las dedicatorias, etc.) encontradas al comienzo de un documento, antes del cuerpo principal.
represents a feature structure, that is, a collection of feature-value pairs organized as a structural unit.
representa una estructura de rasgos, es decir, una colección de pares de rasgo-valor organizados como una unidad estructural.
specifies constraints on the content of well formed feature structures.
especifica restricciones en el contenido de estructuras de rasgo bien formadas.
declares one type of feature structure.
declara un tipo de estructura del rasgo.
describes in prose what is represented by the type of feature structure declared in the enclosing fsDecl.
describe en prosa lo que se representa mediante el tipo de estructura de rasgos declarada en el elemento declEr (fsDecl) de nivel superior.
identifies the feature system declaration which contains definitions for a particular type of feature structure.
identifica la declaración de sistema de rasgo que contiene las definiciones para un tipo particular de estructura de rasgos.
specifies the name of an individual, institution, or organization responsible for the funding of a project or text.
especifica el nombre de un individuo, institución, u organización responsable de financiar un proyecto o texto.
assembles a library of reusable feature value elements (including complete feature structures).
recopila una biblioteca de elementos de valor de rasgo reusables (incluyendo estructuras de rasgo completas).
contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page.
represents a non-standard character or glyph.
representa un carácter no estándar o glifo.

indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible or inaudible.

indica un punto en una transcripción dónde el material se ha omitido, sea por razones editoriales descritas en el cabezal TEI (teiHeader), sea como parte de una práctica de muestreo, o porque el material es ilegible o inaudible.
identifies the morphological gender of a lexical item, as given in the dictionary.
identifica el género morfológico de un elemento léxico, según aparece en el diccionario.
contains a name component used to indicating generational information, such as Junior, or a number used in a monarch's name.
contiene un componente del nombre usado para indicar información generacional, como Junior, o un número usado en el nombre de un monarca.
contains a common noun identifying some geographical feature contained within a geographic name, such as valley, mount etc.
contiene un nombre común que identifica algún rasgo geográfico contenido dentro de un nombre geográfico, como ser valle, montaña etc.
a name associated with some geographical feature such as Windrush Valley or Mount Sinai.
un nombre asociado con algún rasgo geográfico como Valle Windrush o Monte Sinai.
contains the name (generic identifier) of an element.
identifies a phrase or word used to provide a gloss or definition for some other word or phrase.
provides descriptive information about a character glyph.
proporciona información descriptiva sobre un glifo.
contains the name of a glyph, expressed following Unicode conventions for character names.
contiene el nombre de un glifo, expresado según las convenciones de Unicode para nombres de carácteres.
within an entry in a dictionary or a terminological data file, contains grammatical information relating to a term, word, or form.
groups morpho-syntactic information about a lexical item, e.g. pos, gen, number, case, or itype (inflectional class).
encodes a graph, which is a collection of nodes, and arcs which connect the nodes.

contains the body of a composite text, grouping together a sequence of distinct texts (or groups of such texts) which are regarded as a unit for some purpose, for example the collected works of an author, a sequence of prose essays, etc.
used in the header to define each distinct scribe or handwriting style.
usado en el título para definir cada escriba o estilo de caligrafía diferente.
contains a description of all the different kinds of writing used in a manuscript.
contiene una descripción de todos los tipos de caligrafía diferentes usados en un manuscrito.
contains a series of hand elements listing the different hands of the source.
contiene una serie de elementos calígrafo (hand) que listan los diferentes calígrafos del documento fuente.
describes a particular style or hand distinguished within a manuscript.
describe un estilo o caligrafía particular que destaca en un manuscrito.
marks the beginning of a sequence of text written in a new hand, or of a change in the scribe, writing style, ink or character of the document hand.
marca el principio de una secuencia de texto escrito con una nueva caligrafía, o un cambio de escriba, estilo de escritura, tinta o carácter de la caligrafía del documento.
contains any heading, for example, the title of a section, or the heading of a list or glossary.
contains the heading for the item or gloss column in a glossary list or similar structured list.
contains the heading for the label or term column in a glossary list or similar structured list.
contains a measurement measured along the axis parallel to the spine.
contains a heraldic formula or phrase occurring within such components as blazons, coats of arms, etc. found within a manuscript .
marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made.
groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript or manuscript part.
groups information relating to one homograph within an entry.
the hour component of a temporal expression
el componente hora de una expresión temporal
contains a hyphenated form of a dictionary headword, or hyphenation information in some other form.
contiene una forma de vocablo de diccionario separada en sílabas mediante guiones, o información del corte en sílabas en algún otro formato.
summarizes the way in which hyphenation in a source text has been treated in an encoded version of it.
resume la forma en que la separación en sílabas mediante guiones de un texto fuente ha sido tratada en una versión digital del mismo.
represents an intermediate (or internal) node of a tree.
identifies or names any kind of object
supplies any standard or non-standard number used to identify a bibliographic item.
defines a conditional default value for a feature; the condition is specified as a feature structure, and is met if it subsumes the feature structure in the text for which a default value is sought.
separates the condition from the consequence in a bicond element.
contains a set of TEI Headers exchanged independently of their associated text or group elements.
contains a formal statement authorizing the publication of a work, sometimes required to appear on a title page or its verso.
contiene una declaración formal autorizando la publicación de un trabajo, que a veces se exige que aparezca en una página de título o en su reverso.
groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.

contains the text of any incipit attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, the opening words of a text, frequently used as a form of identifier for it; it may be preceded by one or more rubrics, and may be defective.
marks a location to be indexed for whatever purpose.
contains the name of an organization, such as a University or Library, within which a manuscript repository is located.
describes the extent, cardinality and nature of any interaction among those producing and experiencing the text, for example in the form of response or interjection, commentary etc.
provides for an interpretative annotation which can be linked to a span of text.
collects together interp tags.
describes the scope of any analytic or interpretive information added to the text in addition to the transcription.
contains one component of a list.
indicates the inflectional class associated with a lexical item.
identifies a possibly fragmented segment of text, by pointing at the possibly discontiguous elements which compose it.
groups a collection of join elements and possibly pointers.
contains a list of keywords or phrases identifying the topic or nature of a text.
any communicative phenomenon, not necessarily vocalized, for example a gesture, frown, etc.
cualquier fenómeno comunicativo, no necesariamente vocalizado, como por ejemplo un gesto, fruncir el entrecejo, etc.
contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.
contains the label associated with an item in a list; in glossaries, marks the term being defined.
indicates the end of a lacuna in a mostly complete textual witness.
indica el fin de una laguna en un testigo textual mayoritariamente completo.
indicates the beginning of a lacuna in the text of a mostly complete textual witness.
indica el inicio de una laguna en el texto de un testigo textual mayoritariamente completo.
name of a language mentioned in etymological or other linguistic discussion.
contains an informal description of a person's competence in different languages, dialects, etc.
describes the languages, sublanguages, registers, dialects etc. represented within a text.
characterizes a single language or sublanguage used within a text.
contains a description of ruling technique and layout.
marks the start of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text.
in dictionaries, contains a label for a form, example, translation, or other piece of information, e.g. abbreviation for, contraction of, literally, approximately, synonyms:, etc.
en diccionarios, contiene la etiqueta de una forma, ejemplo, traducción, u otra pieza de información, por ejemplo, abreviatura, contracción, uso literal, uso aproximado, sinónimos, etc.
encodes the leaves (terminal nodes) of a tree.
códifica las hojas (nodos terminales) de un árbol.
contains the lemma, or base text, of a textual variation.
contiene el lema, o texto base, de una variación textual.
contains a group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
contains a first-level (i.e. largest) group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
contiene un grupo de líneas de verso de primer nivel (es decir, el más alto) que funcionan como una unidad formal, como por ejemplo una estrofa, estribillo, párrafo de verso, etc.
contains a second-level (i.e. second largest) group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
contiene un grupo de líneas de verso de segundo nivel (es decir, segundo más alto) que funcionan como una unidad formal, como por ejemplo una estrofa, estribillo, párrafo de verso, etc.
contains a third-level (i.e. third largest) group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
contiene un grupo de líneas de verso de tercer nivel (es decir, tercero más alto) que funcionan como una unidad formal, como por ejemplo una estrofa, estribillo, párrafo de verso, etc.
contains a fourth-level (i.e. fourth largest) group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
contiene un grupo de líneas de verso de cuarto nivel (es decir, cuarto más alto) que funcionan como una unidad formal, como por ejemplo una estrofa, estribillo, párrafo de verso, etc.
contains a fifth-level (i.e. smallest) group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.
contiene un grupo de líneas de verso de quinto nivel (es decir, el más bajo) que funcionan como una unidad formal, como por ejemplo una estrofa, estribillo, párrafo de verso, etc.
contains one line of a reference edition.
defines an association or hypertextual link among elements or passages, of some type not more precisely specifiable by other elements.
defines a collection of associations or hypertextual links.
contains any sequence of items organized as a list.
contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind.
supplies a list of significant references to places where this element is discussed, in the current document or elsewhere.
contains a locally defined name for some property.
contains a brief informal description of the nature of a place for example a room, a restaurant, a park bench etc.
contiene una descripción informal breve de la naturaleza de un lugar por ejemplo un cuarto, un restaurante, un banco del parque, etc.
defines a location within a manuscript or manuscript part, usually as a (possibly discontinuous) sequence of folio references.
define un lugar dentro de un manuscrito o parte manuscrita, normalmente como una sucesión (posiblemente discontinua) de referencias a folios.
represents a grammatical morpheme.
representa un morfema gramatical.
documents the function and implementation of a pattern.
contains one or more characters which are related to the parent character or glyph in some respect, as specified by the type attribute.
contiene uno o más carácteres relacionados de alguna forma con el carácter o glifo padre, según se especifica mediante el atributo tipo (type).
contains a phrase describing the material of which any part of a manuscript or binding is composed.
contiene una frase que describe el material de cual está compuesta cualquier parte de un manuscrito o encuadernación.
contains a word or phrase referring to some quantity of an object or commodity, usually comprising a number, a unit, and a commodity name.
in bibliographic references, contains a description of the meeting or conference from which the bibliographic item derives.
specifies class membership of the parent element or class.
marks words or phrases mentioned, not used.

documents the notation employed to represent a metrical pattern when this is specified as the value of a met, real, or rhyme attribute on any structural element of a metrical text (e.g. lg, l, or seg).
documents the intended significance of a particular character or character sequence within a metrical notation, either explicitly or in terms of other symbol elements in the same metDecl.
marks the boundary between sections of a text, as indicated by changes in a standard reference system.
the minute component of a structured time-expression.
el componente minuto de una expresión de tiempo estructurada.
references a module which is to be incorporated into a schema.
documents the structure, content, and purpose of a single module, i.e. a named and externally visible group of declarations.
contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. a book or journal) published as an independent item (i.e. as a separate physical object).
the month component of a structured date.
el componente mes de una fecha estructurada.
contains information about the grammatical mood of verbs (e.g. indicative, subjunctive, imperative)
contiene información sobre el modo verbal (por ejemplo indicativo, subjuntivo, imperativo)
marks the actual entrance or exit of one or more characters on stage.
marca la verdadera entrada o salida de uno o más personajes en escena.
describes the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items.
contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript or manuscript part
contains the information required to identify a given manuscript or manuscript part uniquely within its holding institution.
describes an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part.
contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or manuscript fragment now forming part of a composite manuscript.
contains description of type of musical notation.
contains a proper noun or noun phrase.
contains a connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it, such as van der or of.
contiene una frase o nexo de conexión usado dentro de un nombre pero que no se considera parte de él, como ser "van der" o "del".
encodes a node, a possibly labeled point in a graph.
codifica un nodo, un punto posiblemente etiquetado en un gráfo.
indicates the extent of normalization or regularization of the original source carried out in converting it to electronic form.
contains a note or annotation.
collects together any notes providing information about a text additional to that recorded in other parts of the bibliographic description.
contains a number, written in any form.
indicates grammatical number associated with a form, as given in a dictionary.
represents a numeric value or range of values for a feature.
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to the orthographic form(s) of the headword.
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to variant orthographic form(s) of the headword.
a temporal expression (either a date or a time) given in terms of a named occasion such as a holiday, a named time of day, or some notable event.
contains an informal description of a person's trade, profession or occupation.
that part of a relative temporal or spatial expression which indicates the direction of the offset between the two place names, dates, or times involved in the expression.
groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a preliminary group at the start of a division, especially of a letter.
indicates a division, branch or department specified in an organizational name.
contains an organizational name.
contains the proper name component of an organizational name.
indicates a part of the organization name which contains information about the organization's structure or function.
contains the original form of a reading, for which a regularized form is given in an attribute value.
contains any form of date, used to identify the date of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part.
contains any form of place name, used to identify the place of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part.
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the origin of a manuscript or manuscript part.
gives the orthographic form of a dictionary headword.
marks paragraphs in prose.
marca párrafos en prosa.
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to the pronunciation(s) of the headword.
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to variant pronunciation(s) of the headword.
marks pages in a reference edition.
marca páginas en una edición de referencia.
describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in a linguistic interaction.
describes the relationships or social links existing between participants in a linguistic interaction.
a pause either between or within utterances.
marks the boundary between one page of a text and the next in a standard reference system.
contains an indication of the grammatical person (1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.) associated with a given inflected form in a dictionary.
contains a section of front or back matter describing how a dramatic piece is to be performed in general or how it was performed on some specific occasion.
contains a proper noun or proper-noun phrase referring to a person, possibly including any or all of the person's forenames, surnames, honorifics, added names, etc.
describes a single participant in a language interaction.
describes a group of individuals treated as a single person for analytic purposes.
represents a grammatical phrase.
representa una frase gramatical.
contains a full physical description of a manuscript, either as a sequence of paragraphs, or as a series of more specialised elements.
contains an absolute or relative place name.
indicates the part of speech assigned to a dictionary headword (noun, verb, adjective, etc.)
contains a number or other identifier for some postal delivery point other than a street address.
contains a numerical or alphanumeric code used as part of a postal address to simplify sorting or delivery of mail.
describes the extent to which a text may be regarded as prepared or spontaneous.
supplies the name of the principal researcher responsible for the creation of an electronic text.
provides a detailed description of non-bibliographic aspects of a text, specifically the languages and sublanguages used, the situation in which it was produced, the participants and their setting.
describes in detail the aim or purpose for which an electronic file was encoded, together with any other relevant information concerning the process by which it was assembled or collected.
contains the prologue to a drama, typically spoken by an actor out of character, possibly in association with a particular performance or venue.
contains the pronunciation(s) of the word.
contains any descriptive or other information concerning a single identifiable episode during the history of a manuscript or manuscript part, after its creation but before its acquisition.
defines a pointer to another location in the current document in terms of one or more identifiable elements.
contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.
groups information concerning the publication or distribution of an electronic or other text.
provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.
characterizes a single purpose or communicative function of the text.

contains a quotation or apparent quotation — a representation of speech or thought marked as being quoted from someone else (whether in fact quoted or not); in narrative, the words are usually those of a character or speaker; in dictionaries, q may be used to mark real or contrived examples of usage.
specifies editorial practice adopted with respect to quotation marks in the original.
contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.
contains a single reading within a textual variation.
within a textual variation, groups two or more readings perceived to have a genetic relationship or other affinity.
contains a dictionary entry for a lexical item related to the headword, such as a compound phrase or derived form, embedded inside a larger entry.
provides information about the source and revision status of the parent manuscript description itself.
details of an audio or video recording event used as the source of a spoken text, either directly or from a public broadcast.
describes a set of recordings used in transcription of a spoken text.
defines a reference to another location in the current document, in terms of one or more identifiable elements, possibly modified by additional text or comment.
specifies how canonical references are constructed for this text.
contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.

in an address, contains the state, province, county or region name; in a place name given as a hierarchy of geo-political units, the region is larger or administratively superior to the settlement and smaller or administratively less important than the country.
describes any kind of relationship or linkage amongst a specified group of participants.
contains any commentary or discussion about the usage of an element, attribute, class, or entity not otherwise documented within the containing element.
supplies information about the intended rendition of one or more elements.
contains the name of a repository (usually a distinct physical building) within which manuscripts are stored, forming part of an institution.
describes a person's present or past places of residence.
contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility.

supplies a statement of responsibility for someone responsible for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply.
identifies the individual(s) responsible for some aspect of the markup of particular element(s).
indicates restoration of text to an earlier state by cancellation of an editorial or authorial marking or instruction.
summarizes the revision history for a file.
the name of a dramatic role, as given in a cast list.
describes a character's role in a drama.
contains a name component which indicates that the referent has a particular role or position in society, such as an official title or rank.
represents the root node of a tree.
representa el nodo raíz de un árbol.
contains one row of a table.
contains a general purpose name or referring string.

contains the text of any rubric or heading attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, a string of words whereby a manuscript signals a text division (e.g. beginning, book, chapter, end) which is in some way set off from the text itself, usually in red ink,or by use of different size or type of script, lining, or other such visual device.
contains a sentence-like division of a text.
contains a salutation or greeting prefixed to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text, or the salutation in the closing of a letter, preface, etc.
contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection.
generates a TEI-conformant schema and documentation for it.
contains a citation giving details of the script used for a spoken text.
contains a description of one seal or similar attachment applied to a manuscript
describes the seals or other external items attached to a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct seal elements, possibly with additional decoNotes.

The word or words that a cataloguer, typically medieval but possibly modern as well, might take from a fixed point in all the codices he is describing (the beginning of the second leaf, the beginning of the second column, the beginning of the penultimate leaf, the end of the penultimate leaf, and so on) in order to provide a unique identifier to the particular codex.
the second component of a structured time-expression.
el componente segundos en una expresión de tiempo estructurada.
contains any arbitrary phrase-level unit of text (including other seg elements).
contiene cualquier unidad de texto arbitraria a nivel de frase (incluyendo otros elementos seg).
describes the principles according to which the text has been segmented, for example into sentences, tone-units, graphemic strata, etc.
groups together all information relating to one word sense in a dictionary entry (definitions, examples, translation equivalents, etc.)
contains information about the series in which a book or other bibliographic item has appeared.
groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs.
contains a description of the setting, time, locale, appearance, etc., of the action of a play, typically found in the front matter of a printed performance text (not a stage direction).
describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place.
describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, either as a prose description or as a series of setting elements.
contains the name of the smallest component of a place name expressed as a hierarchy of geo-political or administrative units as in Rochester, New York; Glasgow, Scotland.
marks the point at which some paralinguistic feature of a series of utterances by any one speaker changes.
contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.
contains discussion of the leaf or quirte signatures found within a codex.
contains the closing salutation, etc., appended to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text.
contains a word or phrase for which the author or narrator indicates a disclaiming of responsibility, for example by the use of scare quotes or italics.
contains an informal description of a person's perceived social or economic status.
describes a sound effect or musical sequence specified within a screen play or radio script.
describes the original source for the information contained with a manuscript description.
supplies a description of the source text(s) from which an electronic text was derived or generated.
An individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.
indicates the location of a significant space in the copy text.
associates an interpretative annotation directly with a span of text.
collects together span tags.
A specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.
indicates that a description of the specified element should be included at this point within a tagList.
contains any convenient grouping of specifications for use within the current module.
indicates that the declarations contained by the specGrp referenced should be inserted at this point.
marks where a list of descriptions is to be inserted into the prose documentation.
specifies the name of a sponsoring organization or institution.
contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.
specifies one component of a canonical reference defined by the milestone method.
specifies the format used when standardized date or number values are supplied.
specifies one component of a canonical reference defined by the stepwise method.
a full street address including any name or number identifying a building as well as the name of the street or route on which it is located.
contains the stress pattern for a dictionary headword, if given separately.
provides a string value for a feature.
contains the intended expansion for the entity documented by an patternSpec element, enclosed by quotation marks.
contains subcategorization information (transitive/intransitive, countable/non-countable, etc.)
contains a brief summary of the intellectual content of an item, provided by the cataloguer
groups successive entries for a set of homographs.
signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor in place of text which cannot be read, either because of physical damage or loss in the original or because it is illegible for any reason.
contains a description of the physical components supporting the inscription.
contains a family (inherited) name, as opposed to a given, baptismal, or nick name.
contains information about any digital or photographic representations of the manuscript being described which may exist in the holding institution or elsewhere.
contains the syllabification of the headword.
provides a symbolic feature value.
contains text displayed in tabular form, in rows and columns.
contains text of a complete start- or end-tag, possibly including attribute specifications, but excluding the opening and closing markup delimiter characters.
supplies information about the usage of a specific element within a text.
provides detailed information about the tagging applied to an SGML or XML document.
defines a typology used to classify texts either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.
describes a special-purpose stage direction that is not meant for the actors.
contains the whole of a TEI encoded corpus, comprising a single corpus header and one or more TEI elements, each containing a single text header and a text.
contains a feature system declaration.
supplies the descriptive and declarative information making up an electronic title page prefixed to every TEI-conformant text.
contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.
contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example a poem or drama, a collection of essays, a novel, a dictionary, or a corpus sample.
groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc.
provides a description of a text in terms of its situational parameters.
proporciona una descripción de un texto mediante sus parámetros circunstanciales.
describes the languages and writing systems used by a manuscript (as opposed to its description, which is described in the langUsage element)
separates the condition from the default in an if, or the antecedent and the consequent in a cond element.
contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.
contains two times or another phrase indicating a time period.
contains an internally structured representation for a time of day.
provides a set of ordered points in time which can be linked to elements of a spoken text to create a temporal alignment of that text.
contains the title of a work, whether article, book, journal, or series, including any alternative titles or subtitles.
contains the title page of a text, appearing within the front or back matter.
contains a subsection or division of the title of a work, as indicated on a title page.
groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its intellectual content.
indicates the grammatical tense associated with a given inflected form in a dictionary.
contains a translation of the headword or an example.
contains a closing title or footer appearing at the end of a division of a text.
contains translation text and related information (within an entry in a multilingual dictionary).
encodes a tree, which is made up of a root, internal nodes, leaves, and arcs from root to leaves.
codifica un árbol, compuesto de una raíz, nodos interiores, hojas, y arcos de la raíz a las hojas.
provides for an underspecified eTree, that is, an eTree with information left out.
a stretch of speech usually preceded and followed by silence or by a change of speaker.
contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.
contains the name of a registered Unicode normative or informative property.
contains usage information in a dictionary entry.
represents a feature value which is the disjunction of the values it contains.
represents a feature value which is the result of collecting together the feature values it combines, using the organization specified by the ORG attribute.

declares the default value to be supplied when a feature structure does not contain an instance of f for this name; if unconditional, it is specified as one (or, depending on the value of the org attribute of the enclosing fDecl) more fs elements or primitive values; if conditional, it is specified as one or more if elements; if no default is specified, or no condition matches, the value none is assumed.
represents a feature value which is the negation of its content.

defines the range of allowed values for a feature, in the form of an fs, vAlt, or primitive value; for the value of an f to be valid, it must be subsumed by the specified range; if the f contains multiple values (as sanctioned by the org attribute), then each value must be subsumed by the vRange.
contains a single attribute value.
specifies any semantic or syntactic constraint on the value that an attribute may take, additional to the information carried by the datatype element.
contains a single value and gloss pair for an attribute.
contains one or more valItem elements defining possible values for an attribute.
contains a single value for some property, attribute, or other analysis.
indicates that the feature value is shared with other values bearing the same label within the current scope.
declares the method used to encode text-critical variants.
serves as the root element for a concurrent markup stream which will be used to mark page and line numbers of a reference edition of the text.
describes the visual context of some part of a screen play in terms of what the spectator sees, generally independent of any dialogue.
any vocalized but not necessarily lexical phenomenon, for example voiced pauses, non-lexical backchannels, etc.
marks the individual volumes of a reference edition.
represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word.
contains a detailed description of the watermarks identified in the paper of which a manuscript is composed.
the week component of a structured date.
el componente semana de una fecha estructurada.
indicates a point in time either relative to other elements in the same timeline tag, or absolutely.
contains a measurement measured along the axis perpendicular to the spine.
contains a list of one or more sigla of witnesses attesting a given reading, in a textual variation.
gives further information about a particular witness, or witnesses, to a particular reading.
indicates the end, or suspension, of the text of a fragmentary witness.
contains a list of all the witnesses referred to in wit elements or wit attributes within the critical apparatus.
indicates the beginning, or resumption, of the text of a fragmentary witness.
contains either a description of a single witness referred to within the critical apparatus, or a list of witnesses which is to be referred to by a single sigil.
a passage of written text revealed to participants in the course of a spoken text.
un pasaje de texto escrito revelado a los participantes durante el transcurso de un texto hablado.
defines a pointer to another location in the current document or an external document.
define un puntero a otra ubicación en el documento actual o en un documento externo.
contains a phrase, sentence, or icon referring the reader to some other location in this or another text.
contiene una frase, sentencia, o icono que deriva al lector a alguna otra ubicación en este u otro texto.
defines a reference to another location in the current document, or an external document, using an extended pointer notation, possibly modified by additional text or comment.
define una referencia a otra ubicación en el documento actual, o en un documento externo, usando una notación de puntero extendido, posiblemente modificada por un texto adicional o comentario.
the year component of a date.
el componente año en una fecha.

attribute.desc: gives the abbreviation in its unexpanded form.
supplies an absolute value for the time.
specifies the number of active participants (or addressors) producing parts of the text.
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are both adjacent to and adjacent from the current node.
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent from the current node.
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent to the current node.
specifies the age group to which the participant belongs.
In the case of text omitted from the transcription because of damage or other phenomenon resulting from an identifiable cause, signifies the causative agent.
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.
indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.
gives the maximum number of children of the root and internal nodes of the tree.

provides an alternative value for the aspect of the markup in question—an alternative generic identifier, transcription, or attribute value, or the identifier of an anchor element (to indicate an alternative starting or ending location). If an assertedValue is given, the confidence level specified by degree applies to the alternative markup specified by assertedValue; if none is given, it applies to the markup in the text.
supplies attribute names for which descriptions should be obtained.
identifies the morpheme's base form.

gives the name of the feature structure type from which this type inherits features and constraints; if this type declares a feature with the same name as a feature of the base type, the definition within this fsDecl overrides the inherited definition. The fsConstraints are inherited only if this fsDecl does not specify any; otherwise the constraints in this fsDecl override. When no baseType is specified, no features or constraints are inherited.
indicates the system or calendar to which the date belongs.
classifies the reading as original or non-original, according to some typology of possible origins.
signifies the degree of certainty ascribed to the expansion of the abbreviation.
indicates the degree of precision to be attributed to the date.
describes other characteristics of the hand, particularly those related to the quality of the writing.
provides a list of identifiers of the elements which are the children of the root node.
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item
identifies an occupation code defined within the classification system or taxonomy defined by the scheme attribute.
indicates the number of columns in each row of the table.
specifies the number of columns per page
specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.
gives a correction for the apparent error in the copy text.
points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.
specifies when the pointer was created.
identifies the creator of the TEI Header.
specifies the date of birth in an ISO standard form (yyyy-mm-dd).
indicates when the first version of the header was created.
indicates when the current version of the header was created.
identifies one or more declarable elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.
indicates whether or not this element is selected by default when its parent is selected.
indicates whether the explicit as given is defective, i.e. incomplete.
indicates the degree of confidence assigned to the aspect of the markup named by the locus attribute.
supplies a delimiting string following the reference component.
The name of a module on which this object depends.
gives a description of the omitted text.
indicates whether the space is horizontal or vertical.
may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.
indicates whether the sound overlaps the surrounding speeches or interrupts them.
specifies the document within which the desired location is to be found.
identifies the document type within which this reference declaration is used.
optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie.
indicates the length of this element in time, using either specific units or the units specified on the associated temporal alignment.
indicates which edition or version the milestone applies to.
indicates the location within a temporal alignment at which this element ends.
indicates that the end of a verse line is marked by enjambement.
names the external entity within which the graphic image of the figure is stored.
indicates whether or not end-of-line hyphenation has been retained in a text.
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the dating.
indicates the precision to be attached to either or both dates specified.
points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element.
gives an expansion of the abbreviation.
gives an expanded form of information presented more concisely in the dictionary

indicates approximately how much text has been omitted from the transcription, in letters, minims, inches, or any appropriate unit, either because of editorial policy or because a deletion, damage, or other cause has rendered transcription impossible.
references any element which can be used to represent the value of a feature.
references the feature-value specifications making up this feature structure.
a paralinguistic feature.
indicates whether or not this is the first or main scribe of the document.
provides an identifier of the element which this node follows.
specifies how quotation marks are indicated within the text.
specifies the start of the destination of the pointer, as an expression in the TEI extended-pointer notation.
specifies the external entity containing the feature system declaration; an entity declaration in the document's DTD subset must associate the entity name with a file on the system.
indicates whether the name component is given in full, as an abbreviation or simply as an initial.
characterizes the function of the segment.
the name (generic identifier) of the element indicated by the tag.
indicates conditions assumed in the assignment of a degree of confidence.
indicates whether the writing is revealed all at once or gradually.
in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand, signifies the hand which made the deletion.
specifies the number of distinct hands identified within the manuscript
The display height of the image
provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the ID value.
specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text which bear a distinct value for the global id attribute.
gives the in degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent from the given node.
indicates which other witnesses are included in a witness group.
indicates which index (of several) the index entry belongs to.
describes tint or type of ink, e.g. brown. May also be used to indicate the writing medium, e.g. pencil,
points to instances of the analysis or interpretation represented by the current element.
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval
indicates whether or not the phenomenon is repeated.
provides an alternative identifier for the object being named, such as a database record key.
supplies a label for the variable.
gives a second label for a node.
indicates the language of the element content, usually using a two- or three-letter code from ISO 639.
supplies a pre-defined identifier for the chief language used in the manuscript.
identifies the word's lemma (dictionary entry form).
specifies the fixed length of the reference component.
indicates whether this is the title of an article, book, journal, series, or unpublished material.
gives the form under which the index entry is to be made.
gives the second-level form, if any.
gives the third-level form, if any.
gives the fourth-level form, if any.
indicates the location of the variation, when the location-referenced method of apparatus markup is used.
indicates whether the apparatus appears within the running text or external to it.
indicates the precise location of the uncertainty in the markup: applicability of the element, precise position of the start- or end-tag, value of a specific attribute, etc.
indicates dominant language of hand.
indicates whether or not quotation marks have been retained as content within the text.
supplies an upper bound for the numeric value represented.
describes the tint or type of ink, e.g. brown, or other writing medium, e.g. pencil,
gives a reference to another element, where the original appears as a merged form.
contains a user-specified encoding for the conventional metrical structure of the element.
indicates the method adopted to indicate corrections within the text.
